summary:
It's magic, baby - 9 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/VtSJ6Z6weV

In a universe where The Avengers are all together and everyone is...
caption: It’s magic, baby - 9 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/VtSJ6Z6weV In a universe where The Avengers are all together and everyone is still alive, a new old face comes along. She has created an image for herself and trying to explain who she really is, proves to be quite difficult. Especially when her own brother is Tony Stark. Trying to reshape your image is difficult in the public eye.

summary:
I just woke up from a weirdest dream ive ever had. 
My older brother was chilling in some kind of hotel room and watching a...
body:
I just woke up from a weirdest dream ive ever had.

My older brother was chilling in some kind of hotel room and watching a movie. I want interested in until I spotted rdj and Holand on the screen. I remember that they were walking alongside some cave next to a big waterfall or something. There were glowing fireflies everywhere, and they looked scared and depressed. Then Thor appeared and together they ran for their lives, jumping in waterfall.

And then I woke up.

Brain, I’m fucking disappointed, why? I even remember that it was on YouTube in 40min parts, titled as Dla Marysienki (written in those Russian letters). And now I’m terrified of my mind.

blog.description: Buy Me A Coffee Patreon Page WARNING:These tags do include NSFW posts Marvel Doctor Who Harry Potter LOTR Sherlock Supernatural Star Wars OUAT Teen Wolf DC Others Oneshots Aesthetic Fake Texts Headcanons Moodboards NSFW An imagines blog for any and all fandoms. Please note that I do not own any of the gifs used and if you see any of your own gifs, then message me and I will happily put your name in the tags, to give credit where credit is due or remove it if that is what you wish. You are always welcome to write stories based on any of the imagines I myself will do gif imagines, fake texts, aesthetics and headcanons. However any oneshots on the blog are wrote by followers. If you wish to submit a oneshot idea than I will post it to everyone, however it is up to them if it is actually published. NSFW posts are published on the last Sunday of the month. All fandoms are welcome.

body:
Dragonsilver’s Epilouge

So I know barely anyone except me cares about this, but my OC got married today, and I’ve written a fic of it, enjoy

Words: 1528

Warnings: none

—

“Hey sis, you alright?” Tony asked.

“Yeah, I’m just kinda nervous I guess,” Anna mumbled, “to be honest, I’m not really sure what I’m feeling right now.”

“It’s perfectly normal to be nervous, I was when Pepper and I got married. But you have nothing to worry about, even if things do go wrong it doesn’t matter, you’ve got each other.”

“Yeah, I know,” She replied.

Soon enough their car pulled up outside the venue; a beautiful lakeside garden Wanda had found.

Tony stepped out first, coming over to Anna’s side to open the door. “You ready?”

“As I’ll ever be,” Anna replied, stepping out and taking her brother’s hand, bouquet held in the other.

From the car park it was a short walk through the gardens to get to the wedding site. On any other day she was sure she would’ve enjoyed this walk, but she couldn’t focus on any of the beautiful details now. Her excitement, and nerves, were building with every step.

They quickly arrived at the gate in the hedges. The gate was closed, but Wanda and Cassie were waiting for them on their side.

Cassie gasped when she saw Anna, “Oh my gosh, your wedding dress is so pretty!”

The dress was simple, but very pretty. The slight V neck and thin straps made it look elegant, and the light skirt seemed to float around her.

“Thanks,” Anna replied, smiling. “Your dress looks pretty too.”

Wanda came over to adjust Anna’s flower crown, “Everything’s gone perfectly so far, all that’s left is us.”

Knowing that there hadn’t been any problems so far helped calm Anna.

“I’m ready,” she said.

Wanda’s magic swirled around, slowly easing the gate open as the music started. She stepped out first, walking down the aisle.

Once she reached the end Cassie went next, sprinkling purple and blue flower petals down the aisle.

Anna glanced at Tony, who was already smiling at her.

She didn’t hesitate to step out from behind the hedge and through the gate.

The scene in front of her was more beautiful than she could have ever imagined (and she had done a lot of imagining).

All the wedding guests had turned to look at her. Usually she didn’t like to be the centre of attention but she couldn’t care less now.

The decorations were just as her bridesmaids had described them, all purple and blue, which contrasted perfectly with the colours of the garden.

When she looked to the altar, a giant flower covered arch, she saw Sharon, the officiant, as well as the bridesmaids, groomsmen, and Clint and Wanda, the best man and maid of honour.

And her Fiancé, Pietro, the man she was about to marry.

He looked extremely handsome in his black suit. Anna was glad Tony was holding her hand, otherwise she might not have been able to resist running up and kissing him.

The walk down the aisle felt painfully long, yet Anna found herself enjoying every moment of it. She loved the way Pietro was gazing at her as if there was no one else in the whole world.

She still couldn’t believe this was actually happening. She was about to be married to the man of her dreams.

When they reached the end of the aisle the music quietened. Anna took her place at the altar, standing by Pietro. Neither of them said anything. The look they shared was worth more than a thousand words.

After a moment of silence, Sharon spoke up, “We’re gathered here today to celebrate the relationship of Anna and Pietro, and to be witnesses and supporters of the commitment they share with one another.”

Anna couldn’t help but smile at her words. Sharon had been Anna’s best friend since childhood and was glad to have a part in the wedding.

“They wanted me to thank you all for being here today. And to remind each and every one of you of the part you’ve played in their lives, if it weren’t for you they wouldn’t be where they are today.”

“Speaking of which,” she added, “none were more important than their families. That being said, who gives the bride away in marriage to this man?”

“No one,” Tony said, “She’s her own person, not property to be given away. But she has my blessing.”

Anna had known that her brother would say something like this. They’d discussed the whole walking down the aisle thing, which was an idea that Anna liked, but the whole giving the bride away thing bothered her. She wasn’t his property.

But hearing him say it was perfect. This was her own choice, no one was giving her away, but she knew that he still supported her decision.

Tony pulled her in for one last hug and a kiss on the cheek before moving to stand with the rest of the groomsmen. Anna handed her bouquet to Wanda so she could hold hands with Pietro.

“Love isn’t always perfect.” Sharon said, “it isn’t a fairytale or a storybook. And it doesn’t always come easy. Love is overcoming obstacles, facing challenges, fighting to be together, holding on and never letting go. It’s a short word, easy to spell, difficult to define, and impossible to live without. Love is work, but most of all, love is realising that every hour, every minute, and every second was worth it, because you did it together.”

“I believe you’ve prepared vows?”

Anna nodded. She’d written them down, but she’d gone over them in her head so many times that she’d memorised them. “Before I met you, I thought I knew how love worked. I understood the chemistry, how attraction was created by hormones and neurotrophins. But no amount of understanding could have prepared me for actually experiencing it. And I do think that this is the only time I’ve experienced it, there were times before when I thought that I’d been in love, but it was nothing compared to what I feel for you. I guess what I’m trying to say is, falling in love has been the greatest experience of my life, and I’m glad it was with you.”

Pietro didn’t need to respond with words, his reaction was crystal clear from the way he looked at her with complete adoration.

After a few moments, he spoke in Sokovian. “I often find myself thinking that it’d be impossible for me to fall any more in love with you, yet every single time you manage to prove me wrong. Words can’t describe how much I care about you. And even if you don’t think you’re perfect, you’re perfect for me.”

She wasn’t surprised that he said it in Sokovian. He wasn’t always the best at showing his affection with words, and she knew he’d be more comfortable saying it if she was one of the only ones who could hear him. In fact, knowing that barely anyone else knew what he said made the words melt her heart even more.

Sharon motioned to Wanda and Clint, who handed the rings to Anna and Pietro. “The couple will now exchange rings to symbolise their commitment. Pietro, please take Anna’s hand and repeat these words.”

He took her hand, and Anna managed to get a look at the ring. It was a thin rose gold band covered in purple and white gemstones.

“I give you this ring as a symbol of our union,” Sharon said.

“I give you this ring as a symbol of our union,” Pietro repeated, slipping the ring onto Anna’s finger.

“Anna, please take Pietro’s hand and repeat these words,” Sharon said. “I give you this ring as a symbol of our union.”

Anna took his hand, “I give you this ring as a symbol of our union.”

She slipped the ring onto his finger. To some people the ring Anna had made him may have looked strange, with it’s uneven edge and blue colour, but now that it had connected to its other half, the silver engagement ring, it looked perfect, the uneven edges lining up beautifully.

“Now, I have one last question for you…” Sharon said. “Annabeth, do you take this man to be your lawfully wedded husband; and promise to love and be faithful to him until the end of your days?”

“I do.”

“Pietro, do you take this woman to be your lawfully wedded wife; and promise to love and be faithful to her until the end of your days?”

“I do.”

“By the power vested in me I now pronounce you husband and wife. You may kiss the bride.”

Pietro wrapped his arms around her, pulling her close and kissing her. Anna’s arms snaked around his neck and she pressed herself even closer.

It was the best kiss she’d ever had, and it ended far too soon.

Everyone was still clapping and cheering when they broke apart, still staying close with their foreheads touching.

She couldn’t quite believe it. They were married.

“I love you so much,” she whispered.

“I love you too,” he replied.

This was the ending of their story, their epilogue. But Anna knew their adventures were just beginning.

We’re in the endgame now.

The decorations were just as her bridesmaids had described them, all purple and blue, which contrasted perfectly with the colours of the garden.

When she looked to the altar, a giant flower covered arch, she saw Sharon, the officiant, as well as the bridesmaids, groomsmen, and Clint and Wanda, the best man and maid of honour.

And her Fiancé, Pietro, the man she was about to marry.

He looked extremely handsome in his black suit. Anna was glad Tony was holding her hand, otherwise she might not have been able to resist running up and kissing him.

The walk down the aisle felt painfully long, yet Anna found herself enjoying every moment of it. She loved the way Pietro was gazing at her as if there was no one else in the whole world.

She still couldn’t believe this was actually happening. She was about to be married to the man of her dreams.

When they reached the end of the aisle the music quietened. Anna took her place at the altar, standing by Pietro. Neither of them said anything. The look they shared was worth more than a thousand words.

After a moment of silence, Sharon spoke up, “We’re gathered here today to celebrate the relationship of Anna and Pietro, and to be witnesses and supporters of the commitment they share with one another.”

Anna couldn’t help but smile at her words. Sharon had been Anna’s best friend since childhood and was glad to have a part in the wedding.

“They wanted me to thank you all for being here today. And to remind each and every one of you of the part you’ve played in their lives, if it weren’t for you they wouldn’t be where they are today.”

“Speaking of which,” she added, “none were more important than their families. That being said, who gives the bride away in marriage to this man?”

“No one,” Tony said, “She’s her own person, not property to be given away. But she has my blessing.”

Anna had known that her brother would say something like this. They’d discussed the whole walking down the aisle thing, which was an idea that Anna liked, but the whole giving the bride away thing bothered her. She wasn’t his property.

But hearing him say it was perfect. This was her own choice, no one was giving her away, but she knew that he still supported her decision.

Tony pulled her in for one last hug and a kiss on the cheek before moving to stand with the rest of the groomsmen. Anna handed her bouquet to Wanda so she could hold hands with Pietro.

“Love isn’t always perfect.” Sharon said, “it isn’t a fairytale or a storybook. And it doesn’t always come easy. Love is overcoming obstacles, facing challenges, fighting to be together, holding on and never letting go. It’s a short word, easy to spell, difficult to define, and impossible to live without. Love is work, but most of all, love is realising that every hour, every minute, and every second was worth it, because you did it together.”

“I believe you’ve prepared vows?”

Anna nodded. She’d written them down, but she’d gone over them in her head so many times that she’d memorised them. “Before I met you, I thought I knew how love worked. I understood the chemistry, how attraction was created by hormones and neurotrophins. But no amount of understanding could have prepared me for actually experiencing it. And I do think that this is the only time I’ve experienced it, there were times before when I thought that I’d been in love, but it was nothing compared to what I feel for you. I guess what I’m trying to say is, falling in love has been the greatest experience of my life, and I’m glad it was with you.”

Pietro didn’t need to respond with words, his reaction was crystal clear from the way he looked at her with complete adoration.

After a few moments, he spoke in Sokovian. “I often find myself thinking that it’d be impossible for me to fall any more in love with you, yet every single time you manage to prove me wrong. Words can’t describe how much I care about you. And even if you don’t think you’re perfect, you’re perfect for me.”

She wasn’t surprised that he said it in Sokovian. He wasn’t always the best at showing his affection with words, and she knew he’d be more comfortable saying it if she was one of the only ones who could hear him. In fact, knowing that barely anyone else knew what he said made the words melt her heart even more.

Sharon motioned to Wanda and Clint, who handed the rings to Anna and Pietro. “The couple will now exchange rings to symbolise their commitment. Pietro, please take Anna’s hand and repeat these words.”

He took her hand, and Anna managed to get a look at the ring. It was a thin rose gold band covered in purple and white gemstones.

“I give you this ring as a symbol of our union,” Sharon said.

“I give you this ring as a symbol of our union,” Pietro repeated, slipping the ring onto Anna’s finger.

“Anna, please take Pietro’s hand and repeat these words,” Sharon said. “I give you this ring as a symbol of our union.”

Anna took his hand, “I give you this ring as a symbol of our union.”

She slipped the ring onto his finger. To some people the ring Anna had made him may have looked strange, with it’s uneven edge and blue colour, but now that it had connected to its other half, the silver engagement ring, it looked perfect, the uneven edges lining up beautifully.

“Now, I have one last question for you…” Sharon said. “Annabeth, do you take this man to be your lawfully wedded husband; and promise to love and be faithful to him until the end of your days?”

“I do.”

“Pietro, do you take this woman to be your lawfully wedded wife; and promise to love and be faithful to her until the end of your days?”

“I do.”

“By the power vested in me I now pronounce you husband and wife. You may kiss the bride.”

Pietro wrapped his arms around her, pulling her close and kissing her. Anna’s arms snaked around his neck and she pressed herself even closer.

It was the best kiss she’d ever had, and it ended far too soon.

Everyone was still clapping and cheering when they broke apart, still staying close with their foreheads touching.

She couldn’t quite believe it. They were married.

“I love you so much,” she whispered.

“I love you too,” he replied.

This was the ending of their story, their epilogue. But Anna knew their adventures were just beginning.

We’re in the endgame now.

trail.content_raw:
Dragonsilver’s Epilouge

So I know barely anyone except me cares about this, but my OC got married today, and I’ve written a fic of it, enjoy

Words: 1528

Warnings: none

—

“Hey sis, you alright?” Tony asked.

“Yeah, I’m just kinda nervous I guess,” Anna mumbled, “to be honest, I’m not really sure what I’m feeling right now.”

“It’s perfectly normal to be nervous, I was when Pepper and I got married. But you have nothing to worry about, even if things do go wrong it doesn’t matter, you’ve got each other.”

“Yeah, I know,” She replied.

Soon enough their car pulled up outside the venue; a beautiful lakeside garden Wanda had found.

Tony stepped out first, coming over to Anna’s side to open the door. “You ready?”

“As I’ll ever be,” Anna replied, stepping out and taking her brother’s hand, bouquet held in the other.

From the car park it was a short walk through the gardens to get to the wedding site. On any other day she was sure she would’ve enjoyed this walk, but she couldn’t focus on any of the beautiful details now. Her excitement, and nerves, were building with every step.

They quickly arrived at the gate in the hedges. The gate was closed, but Wanda and Cassie were waiting for them on their side.

Cassie gasped when she saw Anna, “Oh my gosh, your wedding dress is so pretty!”

The dress was simple, but very pretty. The slight V neck and thin straps made it look elegant, and the light skirt seemed to float around her.

“Thanks,” Anna replied, smiling. “Your dress looks pretty too.”

Wanda came over to adjust Anna’s flower crown, “Everything’s gone perfectly so far, all that’s left is us.”

Knowing that there hadn’t been any problems so far helped calm Anna.

“I’m ready,” she said.

Wanda’s magic swirled around, slowly easing the gate open as the music started. She stepped out first, walking down the aisle.

Once she reached the end Cassie went next, sprinkling purple and blue flower petals down the aisle.

Anna glanced at Tony, who was already smiling at her.

She didn’t hesitate to step out from behind the hedge and through the gate.

The scene in front of her was more beautiful than she could have ever imagined (and she had done a lot of imagining).

All the wedding guests had turned to look at her. Usually she didn’t like to be the centre of attention but she couldn’t care less now.

The decorations were just as her bridesmaids had described them, all purple and blue, which contrasted perfectly with the colours of the garden.

When she looked to the altar, a giant flower covered arch, she saw Sharon, the officiant, as well as the bridesmaids, groomsmen, and Clint and Wanda, the best man and maid of honour.

And her Fiancé, Pietro, the man she was about to marry.

He looked extremely handsome in his black suit. Anna was glad Tony was holding her hand, otherwise she might not have been able to resist running up and kissing him.

The walk down the aisle felt painfully long, yet Anna found herself enjoying every moment of it. She loved the way Pietro was gazing at her as if there was no one else in the whole world.

She still couldn’t believe this was actually happening. She was about to be married to the man of her dreams.

When they reached the end of the aisle the music quietened. Anna took her place at the altar, standing by Pietro. Neither of them said anything. The look they shared was worth more than a thousand words.

After a moment of silence, Sharon spoke up, “We’re gathered here today to celebrate the relationship of Anna and Pietro, and to be witnesses and supporters of the commitment they share with one another.”

Anna couldn’t help but smile at her words. Sharon had been Anna’s best friend since childhood and was glad to have a part in the wedding.

“They wanted me to thank you all for being here today. And to remind each and every one of you of the part you’ve played in their lives, if it weren’t for you they wouldn’t be where they are today.”

“Speaking of which,” she added, “none were more important than their families. That being said, who gives the bride away in marriage to this man?”

“No one,” Tony said, “She’s her own person, not property to be given away. But she has my blessing.”

Anna had known that her brother would say something like this. They’d discussed the whole walking down the aisle thing, which was an idea that Anna liked, but the whole giving the bride away thing bothered her. She wasn’t his property.

But hearing him say it was perfect. This was her own choice, no one was giving her away, but she knew that he still supported her decision.

Tony pulled her in for one last hug and a kiss on the cheek before moving to stand with the rest of the groomsmen. Anna handed her bouquet to Wanda so she could hold hands with Pietro.

“Love isn’t always perfect.” Sharon said, “it isn’t a fairytale or a storybook. And it doesn’t always come easy. Love is overcoming obstacles, facing challenges, fighting to be together, holding on and never letting go. It’s a short word, easy to spell, difficult to define, and impossible to live without. Love is work, but most of all, love is realising that every hour, every minute, and every second was worth it, because you did it together.”

“I believe you’ve prepared vows?”

Anna nodded. She’d written them down, but she’d gone over them in her head so many times that she’d memorised them. “Before I met you, I thought I knew how love worked. I understood the chemistry, how attraction was created by hormones and neurotrophins. But no amount of understanding could have prepared me for actually experiencing it. And I do think that this is the only time I’ve experienced it, there were times before when I thought that I’d been in love, but it was nothing compared to what I feel for you. I guess what I’m trying to say is, falling in love has been the greatest experience of my life, and I’m glad it was with you.”

Pietro didn’t need to respond with words, his reaction was crystal clear from the way he looked at her with complete adoration.

After a few moments, he spoke in Sokovian. “I often find myself thinking that it’d be impossible for me to fall any more in love with you, yet every single time you manage to prove me wrong. Words can’t describe how much I care about you. And even if you don’t think you’re perfect, you’re perfect for me.”

She wasn’t surprised that he said it in Sokovian. He wasn’t always the best at showing his affection with words, and she knew he’d be more comfortable saying it if she was one of the only ones who could hear him. In fact, knowing that barely anyone else knew what he said made the words melt her heart even more.

Sharon motioned to Wanda and Clint, who handed the rings to Anna and Pietro. “The couple will now exchange rings to symbolise their commitment. Pietro, please take Anna’s hand and repeat these words.”

He took her hand, and Anna managed to get a look at the ring. It was a thin rose gold band covered in purple and white gemstones.

“I give you this ring as a symbol of our union,” Sharon said.

“I give you this ring as a symbol of our union,” Pietro repeated, slipping the ring onto Anna’s finger.

“Anna, please take Pietro’s hand and repeat these words,” Sharon said. “I give you this ring as a symbol of our union.”

Anna took his hand, “I give you this ring as a symbol of our union.”

She slipped the ring onto his finger. To some people the ring Anna had made him may have looked strange, with it’s uneven edge and blue colour, but now that it had connected to its other half, the silver engagement ring, it looked perfect, the uneven edges lining up beautifully.

“Now, I have one last question for you…” Sharon said. “Annabeth, do you take this man to be your lawfully wedded husband; and promise to love and be faithful to him until the end of your days?”

“I do.”

“Pietro, do you take this woman to be your lawfully wedded wife; and promise to love and be faithful to her until the end of your days?”

“I do.”

“By the power vested in me I now pronounce you husband and wife. You may kiss the bride.”

Pietro wrapped his arms around her, pulling her close and kissing her. Anna’s arms snaked around his neck and she pressed herself even closer.

It was the best kiss she’d ever had, and it ended far too soon.

Everyone was still clapping and cheering when they broke apart, still staying close with their foreheads touching.

She couldn’t quite believe it. They were married.

“I love you so much,” she whispered.

“I love you too,” he replied.

This was the ending of their story, their epilogue. But Anna knew their adventures were just beginning.

We’re in the endgame now.

summary: Official Synopsis of Avengers: Endgame Released
title: Official Synopsis of Avengers: Endgame Released
body:
Official Synopsis of Avengers: Endgame Released

While each ticketing site appears to have their own adaptation of a rundown for Avengers: Endgame, there wasn’t an official one from Marvel Studios and Disney… as of not long ago.

Everybody is looking out for the running time for the motion picture, and keeping in mind that that ought to come soon alongside cutting edge tickets, this is the official plot abstract issued by Disney for the film…

View On WordPress
